results.title: Getting even: women in Australian politics
results.brief_description: In 1894 South Australia became one of the first places in the world to grant women the right to vote and first in the world to allow them to stand as candidates for political office. In 1902, the first Parliament of Australia granted white women the right to vote and to stand for election. Despite this, only 61 women have been elected to Federal Parliament in Australia to date. This film looks at why women’s efforts for greater representation have been continually frustrated, and asks what it is that motivates those women who have made it into the main political game. Female politicians from across the political spectrum talk about their experiences in the ‘boy’s club’ of Australian politics. Australia’s first female Premiers, Carmen Lawrence and Joan Kirner, reflect on their experiences of working at the top of State politics. Bronwyn Bishop, Cheryl Kernot, Amanda Vanstone and others, reveal what lies behind the public face of today’s female politicians. This film also examines the future for women in power, and examines the strategies being used by both major political parties to redress the gender imbalance in our parliaments. The film asks what it really takes for a woman to make it in politics. Has the hard won vote been an effective tool for change or has the political system acted to limit women’s influence? Narrated by Gillian Jones.

results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: Miriana Marusic, James Kesteven, Mandy King and Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Telephone technique
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Wesley Greene and Crawley Films
results.brief_description: Part of a series on sales training, this episode deals with telephone training for retail sales clerks. It emphasizes good telephone manners, wide knowledge of stock, importance of correct customer name and address and the necessity for an intelligent descriptive vocabulary when speaking of merchandise over the telephone.

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Soundmasters and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.

results.title: Brisbane: city in the sun
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the pattern of life in Brisbane, Queensland. Aspects such as commerce, tourist appeal and the social pastimes of locals and tourists are depicted. Includes views of the races, the beach and Brisbane River. Camera: Edward Cranstone Sound: Donald Kennedy Music: Don Andrews

results.title: City in the sun
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Loch and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Inspired by Arne Sucksdorff’s “Manniskor i Stad” (Rhythm of a city), this film reflects the mood of a day in the life of Sydney, New South Wales, from morning until night.

results.title: Homosexuality: a film for discussion
results.brief_description: Designed to dispel the myths about homosexuality. Homosexuals talk about their lives, their relationships and the difficulties of growing up gay in an oppressive, intolerant society. Parents of gays speak out and the Melbourne public expresses its view on the subject.

results.title: The Life of Harry Dare (A)
results.creator_credit: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, South Australian Film Corporation, Australian Film Commission and Infinity Pictures
results.brief_description: Harry Dare’s troubles began the day he sighted the Kombi van and despite the warnings of ‘Bad Spirit Trouble’, he just had to have it. When the van is stolen, Harry embarks on a journey with his young estranged son Jim to find it. What Harry really discovers is a more meaningful relationship with his son. Stars John Moore as Harry and Aaron Wilton as Jim.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.
